enum.name: PARACHUTE_ACTION
enum.description: Parachute actions. Trigger release and enable/disable auto-release.

entry.name: MAV_DATA_STREAM_ALBATROS_1
entry.description: Albatros data where default send frequency 1Hz

entry.name: MAV_DATA_STREAM_ALBATROS_2_4
entry.description: Albatros data where default send frequency from 2 to 4 Hz

entry.name: MAV_DATA_STREAM_ALBATROS_4
entry.description: Albatros data where default send frequency 4Hz

entry.name: MAV_DATA_STREAM_ALBATROS_10
entry.description: Albatros data where default send frequency 10Hz

entry.name: MAV_CMD_ALB_POS_CORR
entry.description: Set the distance to be repeated on mission resume

entry.name: MAV_CMD_DO_SET_WIND
entry.description: Sets wind speed and direction from which the wind blows. Will be set only when EK2 is current active AHRS_EHF_TYPE

entry.name: SET_TRACKING
entry.description: Send coomand to tracking with bbox

entry.name: SEND_TRACKING_BBOX
entry.description: Sends a bbox around the tracked object

entry.name: MAV_CMD_PID_ERRORS
entry.description: Set the distance to be repeated on mission resume

entry.name: MAV_MOUNT_MODE_EXTERNAL_TRACKER_TARGETING
entry.description: Auto targeting via Nvidia Jetson module or other

message.name: HEARTBEAT_CAMERA
message.description: This message informs the ground station when the camera is connected or disconnected.

message.name: JETSON_BBOX
message.description: Bbox around tracked object from jetson
message.field: Coordinate X of top left angle of bbox in pixel
Coordinate Y of top left angle of bbox in pixel

message.name: ALB_CAMERA_INFO
message.field: hight 4 bits - camera type; low 4 bits camera num

message.name: ALBATROS_10_MSG
message.description: Message that sends 10 times per sec for Albatros

message.name: ALBATROS_2_4_MSG
message.description: Message that sends from 2 to 4 times per sec for Albatros
message.field: Current throttle setting in integer percent, 0 to 100
hight 4 bits - camera type(0- unknown; 1-XcoreLA; 2-XcoreFTII; 3-Visca); low 4 bits camera num
Latitude (WGS84, EGM96 ellipsoid), in degrees * 1E7. global possition
Longitude (WGS84, EGM96 ellipsoid), in degrees * 1E7, global position
Timestamp of the component clock since boot time in milliseconds.

message.name: ALBATROS_1_MSG
message.description: Message that sends 4 times per sec for Albatros
message.field: Altitude in meters in AMSL altitude, not WGS84 if absolute or relative, above terrain if GLOBAL_TERRAIN_ALT_INT
Remaining battery energy: (0%: 0, 100%: 100), -1: autopilot does not estimate the remaining battery
Vehicle heading (yaw angle) in degrees * 100, 0.0..359.99 degrees. If unknown, set to: UINT16_MAX
Wind direction (that wind is coming from).

message.name: ALBATROS_4_MSG
message.description: Message that sends 1 times per sec for Albatros
message.field: Altitude in meters, expressed as * 1000 (millimeters), AMSL (not WGS84 - note that virtually all GPS modules provide the AMSL as well)
Altitude above ground in meters, expressed as * 1000 (millimeters)

message.name: ALB_SYS_STATUS
message.description: The general system state. If the system is following the MAVLink standard, the system state is mainly defined by three orthogonal states/modes: The system mode, which is either LOCKED (motors shut down and locked), MANUAL (system under RC control), GUIDED (system with autonomous position control, position setpoint controlled manually) or AUTO (system guided by path/waypoint planner). The NAV_MODE defined the current flight state: LIFTOFF (often an open-loop maneuver), LANDING, WAYPOINTS or VECTOR. This represents the internal navigation state machine. The system status shows whether the system is currently active or not and if an emergency occurred. During the CRITICAL and EMERGENCY states the MAV is still considered to be active, but should start emergency procedures autonomously. After a failure occurred it should first move from active to critical to allow manual intervention and then move to emergency after a certain timeout.
message.field: Bitmap showing which onboard controllers and sensors are present. Value of 0: not present. Value of 1: present.
Bitmap showing which onboard controllers and sensors are enabled: Value of 0: not enabled. Value of 1: enabled.
Bitmap showing which onboard controllers and sensors have an error (or are operational). Value of 0: error. Value of 1: healthy.
Battery voltage, UINT16_MAX: Voltage not sent by autopilot
Battery current, -1: Current not sent by autopilot
Consumed charge, in milliampere hours (1 = 1 mAh), -1: autopilot does not provide mAh consumption estimate
Bitmask indicating ekf checks 1: check ok 0: check failed. 1bit-vel; 2bit-pos; 3bit-ght; 4bit-mag; 5bit-arspd; MSB convention
Battery energy remaining, -1: Battery remaining energy not sent by autopilot
